text: Presented results, referring to different transcriptional profiles of pigs infected with three PRRSV strains, create an important platform for further studies on pathogenicity and immune mechanisms used by PRRSV strains of subtype 2 and 1 to sabotage host immune activation. However, more studies are necessary to identify the full spectrum of pathways influenced by particular strains of PRRSV, especially in the context of extensive genetic variability observed within PRRSV.
